intro: Peristrophe schimperiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with prominent cyathia. Peristrophe schimperiana is often used in ornamental gardening due to its resilience and aesthetic appeal.
